required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study on Patterns of Care in Mild Asthmatic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-centre Multi-country Prospective obseRvatIonal Study on Patterns of Care of Mild Asthmatic patiEnts

brief_summary.textblock: The PRIME study is an observational, Real World Evidence study designed to collect the type of treatments that are currently prescribed to patients with mild asthma and to collect relevant clinical data that could reflect the control of the disease over a 6-month observational period according to the standard clinical practice.

detailed_description.textblock: Outpatients attending the hospital clinics/study centres will be recruited. Patients with mild asthma treated by Step 1 or step 2 treatments according to GINA report will be recruited. A total of approximately 1200 patients will be enrolled. Patients will be followed-up during a 6-month observational period according to standard practices.

primary_outcome.measure: To describe the real-world patterns of treatment of subjects with mild asthma during a 6-month observational period.
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of asthma treatments for asthma management, regardless the duration: by active substance by drug class distinguishing between "controller" and "reliever" treatments

primary_outcome.measure: To describe the real-world patterns of treatment of subjects with mild asthma during a 6-month observational period.
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of subjects experiencing asthma treatment switches, step-ups and step-downs during the observation period, along with the description of pattern of switch (in terms of sequence of treatments over time)

primary_outcome.measure: To describe the real-world patterns of treatment of subjects with mild asthma during a 6-month observational period.
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of treatment posology, stratified by type of asthma treatment

primary_outcome.measure: To describe the real-world patterns of treatment of subjects with mild asthma during a 6-month observational period.
primary_outcome.description: Duration of asthma treatments (in months): overall by drug class (i.e., any switch to drugs within the same class will be considered as a continuation of the treatment) and by active substance (i.e., any dose adaptation will be considered as a continuation of the same drug). This will be adapted according to data availability.

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the Socio-demographics data of subjects with mild asthma at enrolment visit
secondary_outcome.description: BMI in kg/m^2

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the clinical characteristics of subjects with mild asthma at enrolment visit
secondary_outcome.description: Lifestyle and smoking habits data description

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the Daytime and night-time symptoms of subjects with mild asthma at enrolment visit
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of daytime and night-time symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the Daytime and night-time symptoms of subjects with mild asthma at enrolment visit
secondary_outcome.description: Type of daytime and night-time symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the Asthma Diagnosis of subjects with mild asthma at enrolment visit
secondary_outcome.description: Time from first Asthma Diagnosis

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the Asthma Diagnosis of subjects with mild asthma at enrolment visit
secondary_outcome.description: Type of diagnosis strategy

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the asthma exacerbations of subjects with mild asthma at enrolment visit
secondary_outcome.description: Asthma exacerbations history data description

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the prior asthma treatment of subjects with mild asthma at enrolment visit
secondary_outcome.description: Type of prior Asthma treatments description

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the clinical characteristics of subjects with mild asthma at enrolment visit
secondary_outcome.description: Skin Prick test data description

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the evolution of lung function parameters (FEV1 (L)) during the 6-month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: Spirometry results at enrolment and at 6-month follow-up visit (according to sites' standard practice): measurement of Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) in L

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the evolution of lung function parameters (FEV1 (%)) during the 6-month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: Spirometry results at enrolment and at 6-month follow-up visit (according to sites' standard practice): measurement of FEV1 predicted value in %,

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the evolution of lung function parameters (FVC (L)) during the 6-month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: Spirometry results at enrolment and at 6-month follow-up visit (according to sites' standard practice): Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) in L

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the evolution of lung function parameters (FVC (%))during the 6-month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: Spirometry results at enrolment and at 6-month follow-up visit (according to sites' standard practice): measurement of FVC % predicted

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the evolution of lung function parameters (FEV1/FVC ratio) during the 6-month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: Spirometry results at enrolment and at 6-month follow-up visit (according to sites' standard practice): measurement of FEV1/FVC ratio in %

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe subjects' level of asthma symptoms control by means of the Asthma Control Test (ACT) during the 6-month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: ACT score. ACT is a 5-point scale (for symptoms and activities: 1=all the time to 5= not at all; for asthma control rating: 1=not controlled at all to 5=completely controlled). ACT scores range from 5 (poor control of asthma) to 25 (complete control of asthma), with higher scores reflecting greater asthma control. An ACT score >19 indicates well-controlled asthma.

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe subjects' level of asthma symptoms control by means of the Asthma Control Questionnaire (ACQ-5) during the 6-month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: ACQ-5 score. ACQ-5 is a 7-point scale (0=no impairment, 6= maximum impairment) and scores range between 0 (totally controlled) and 6 (severely uncontrolled).

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the occurrence of asthma exacerbations during the 6-month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Asthma exacerbations during the 6-month observational period (seriousness, severity, relatedness to the treatment product, start date and end date (duration will be calculated during data analysis), outcome, action taken with respect to drug and other treatments used to treat exacerbations)

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the utilization of healthcare resources in subjects with mild asthma during the 6- month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Inward/Day-hospital hospitalizations, emergency room accesses and GP/outpatient specialist visits

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the utilization of healthcare resources in subjects with mild asthma during the 6- month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: Number and type of tests and exams per subject

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the utilization of healthcare resources in subjects with mild asthma during the 6- month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of Inward/Day-hospital hospitalizations

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the subjects' quality of life by means of the Mini Asthma Quality of Life Questionnaire (MiniAQLQ) during the 6-month observational period
secondary_outcome.description: MiniAQLQ scores. The MiniAQLQ is a 7-point Likert scale (7 = not impaired at all - 1 = severely impaired) and scores range 1-7, with higher scores indicating better quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the occurrence of adverse drug reactions (ADRs) in subjects with mild asthma during the 6-month observational period.
secondary_outcome.description: Only Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs) to any asthma medication occurred during the 6-month observational period will be collected

study_pop.textblock: Mild asthma patients treated by step 1 or 2 treatments according to GINA report

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult subject (aged ≥ 18 years) up to 75 years
- Subject with confirmed asthma diagnosis
- Subject in treatment for mild asthma with Step 1 or Step 2 according to GINA report
- Subject with written privacy and study informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject enrolled in experimental (interventional) clinical trials, or receiving experimental treatments in the prior 3 months
- Known pregnant or breast-feeding subject
- Subject unable to understand and autonomously fill in questionnaires
- Subject unable to use electronic devices to fill in e-diary, or without compatible electronic devices with access to the Internet
- Subject who had asthma exacerbation(s) in the past 4 weeks prior to study entry
- Subject with confirmed Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
